alert.note: Alert for Adams; Fayette; Highland; Pickaway; Pike; Ross; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 06 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EASTERN MASON... NORTHERN LEWIS...EASTERN ADAMS...SOUTHEASTERN FAYETTE...SOUTHWESTERN PICKAWAY...PIKE...EASTERN HIGHLAND...WESTERN SCIOTO AND ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM EDT... At 144 PM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Leesburg to 6 miles north of Peebles to near Tollesboro, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to vegetation. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Chillicothe, Greenfield, Waverly, West Union, Piketon, Manchester, Peebles, Vanceburg, Leesburg, Marshall, Bainbridge, Rome, Highland Holiday, Pike Lake, Kincaid Springs, Tollesboro, Rocky Fork Point, Cynthiana, North Folk Village, and Good Hope. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
